selectedVerses.text: He will flee from an iron weapon; a bronze arrow will strike him through.
The arrow cannot make him flee; for him sling stones are turned to stubble.
he bent his bow and set me as a target for his arrow.
Their tongue is a deadly arrow; it speaks deceitfully; with his mouth each speaks peace to his neighbor, but in his heart he plans an ambush for him.
He made my mouth like a sharp sword; in the shadow of his hand he hid me; he made me a polished arrow; in his quiver he hid me away.
